metadata.title: USN-6184-2 -- CUPS vulnerability
metadata.description: USN-6184-1 fixed a vulnerability in CUPS. This update provides the corresponding updates for Ubuntu 16.04 LTS and Ubuntu 18.04 LTS.  Original advisory details:   It was discovered that CUPS incorrectly handled certain memory operations.  An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause CUPS to crash, resulting  in a denial of service, or to possibly obtain sensitive information.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6184-2` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libcupscgi1 - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.10+esm1 libcups2-dev - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.10+esm1 cups-bsd - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.10+esm1 cups-common - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.10+esm1 cups-core-drivers - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.10+esm1 cups-server-common - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.10+esm1 libcupsimage2 - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.10+esm1 cups-client - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.10+esm1 libcupsmime1 - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.10+esm1 cups-ipp-utils - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.10+esm1 libcups2 - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.10+esm1 cups-ppdc - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.10+esm1 libcupsppdc1 - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.10+esm1 cups - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.10+esm1 libcupsimage2-dev - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.10+esm1 cups-daemon - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.10+esm1 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
